title: Sticky Tense with ki
goal: Learn `ki` to set a tense that persists across sentences.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Compound tense review:

puca'o = ?
baco'a = ?
puze'u = ?

(Answers: was ongoing, will begin, for long time in past)

New Material (5-7 min)

The Problem

Without ki, you must repeat tense in every sentence:

mi pu klama la .paris. .i mi pu penmi la .tam. .i mi pu citka

I went to Paris. I met Tom. I ate.

The Solution: ki

ki "sticks" a tense so it applies to following sentences:

mi pu ki klama la .paris. .i penmi la .tam. .i citka

(In the past:) I went to Paris. Met Tom. Ate.

All three actions are in the past without repeating pu.

Resetting ki

Use ki again to set a new default:

mi pu ki klama la .paris.
.i ca ki tavla la .tam.

(Past:) I went to Paris. (Now:) I talk to Tom.

ki with Spatial Tenses

Works for space too:

mi vi ki viska lo mlatu .i viska lo gerku

(Here:) I see a cat. See a dog. (Both are nearby.)

Key Point

ki sets a tense context that persists until reset. It makes narratives more efficient.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Use pu ki

Write a 3-sentence past narrative using ki:

  1. I went to the store.
  2. I bought apples.
  3. I returned home.
Answer 
mi pu ki klama lo zarci
.i te vecnu lo plise
.i xruti lo zdani

Exercise 2: Use ba ki

Write a 3-sentence future narrative using ki:

  1. I will wake up.
  2. I will eat breakfast.
  3. I will go to work.
Answer 
mi ba ki cikna
.i citka lo cerni cidja
.i klama lo briju

Exercise 3: Switch Tenses

Write sentences that switch from past to present:

  1. (Past) I studied.
  2. (Now) I know.
Answer 
mi pu ki tadni
.i ca ki djuno

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Tell a short story using ki:

Example:

mi pu ki cadzu bu'u lo foldi
.i viska lo cipni
.i gleki
.i ca ki stali lo zdani

(In the past: I walked in the field. Saw a bird. Was happy. Now: I stay at home.)

Today's Grammar

Sticky tense:

Pattern Effect
pu ki Sets past as default
ba ki Sets future as default
ca ki Sets present as default
vi ki Sets "here" as default

Summary

You learned ki to set a sticky tense context. This makes narratives more efficient by avoiding repetition.
